settings.text:
Sometimes, to innovate, to truly break the
bounds of creativity, you need to be a little unruly. For us, unruly
encompasses creativity, passion and a thirst for different ways of doing
things. Combining different media, approaching the market in a different, an unruly
way. Not to say we’re unruly about service, or value, or quality, but unruly
about design. Unruly Design. Social adventure (and occasionally misadventure) through
art and manufacture.

We follow our passion in all the things we
do, and all the relationships we have, with manufacturers, with artisans, with
the very objects and mediums with which we work. We source, co-design and
design pieces that are highly individual while catering to the form and
function of modern lifestyles and spaces. An uncompromising dedication to
quality and service combined with a very unique range makes Unruly.Design a preferred
destination for discerning (collectors, buyers?) across North America and
beyond.

We are a for-profit, we need to make some excess revenue to keep funding the
exploration, and of course if we won lotto we wouldn’t turn it down, in fact
we’d probably get quite – well, unruly,
for a bit, but then we’d be back at it - creating, curating, unearthing more uber
cool “stuff”. We trust some small profit will be a happy by-product if we keep
bringing this passion for design and collaboration with partners and artisans.

settings.title: Manufacturing
settings.text:
Unruly sources a select range of
distinctive homewares, furniture and art from around the globe. We work with
manufacturers, importers, wholesalers and distributors who have that special
something that complements our curated offering to you. That “special
something” always starts with design – does an item fit our profile, our
passion and what Unruly.Design is about.

That’s just the beginning though, our
matching process then takes a thorough look at the ethics and trade practices
of a potential partner – not just due diligence, but can we be proud to list
them and work with them as a partner. Then we examine quality and craftsmanship
– does the item represent the value
we wish to offer to our customers, does the partner stand by their product in
the same way as us.

Then finally, we examine pricing, inventory
and availability, location and other supply chain issues.

Many items, though listed under “Manufactured”
often do not come off a production line and are regularly listed in the
“one-off” category. This is because we bring a very keen attention to sourcing
the different, the unusual, the unruly, and partners who share our passion.

settings.title: Artisans
settings.text:
We work with individuals and cooperatives
across North America and indeed globally who create that “special something”.
We deeply respect these artisans and are extremely proud to offer a channel to
market or to a different customer base to showcase their work.

On the artisans page, you will see detailed
profiles of each creator and all articles marked with the allow you to click
through to see the genesis of each piece through their makers story. We are
always searching for new and unruly pieces, so please contact us if you are an artisan or if you
know of someone whose work should be taken to a wider audience.

settings.title: Mad Scientists
settings.text:
We
also have our own small workshop where we experiment with different ideas,
mediums and finishes. Some of the output from this “lab” will appear on the
one-offs page, some will be taken to the artisans we partner with for a
slightly bigger run and some will be reported to the fire department before the
smoke even clears. Any ideas you may have for design or “mixed media” – please
let us know, we can’t help ourselves and will make it worth your while – see work with us
